data.title: The humorous book of Angeliki with prologue by Alekos Sakellarios

data.text:
PROLOGUE Writing a prologue is such an ungrateful job. The reader doesn’t pay much attention to it since he in a hurry to read the actual content of the book. It’s the only thing that interests him. And what about the prologue? Is it necessary? Probably to introduce in a way, the writer to the…

PROLOGUE

Writing a prologue is such an ungrateful job. The reader doesn’t pay much attention to it since he in a hurry to read the actual content of the book. It’s the only thing that interests him. And what about the prologue? Is it necessary? Probably to introduce in a way, the writer to the readers.

Allow me to introduce you my new colleague Mrs. Angeliki Nikolouli-Mousouli that has written ”Ta piperata tou 100” with great humor and immediacy.

The major qualification of Mrs. Nikolouli is that she requires journalistic experience.

For this kind of books, literature talent is not enough. Literature talent is required to make the text more attractive. And Mrs. Nikolouli’s writing is indeed very attractive. Colorful notes, with great variety of colors, that create a cheerful and breezy painting , this is the image of Athens. Athens with no pollution…

Alekos Sakellarios
